Subjective: Left ear discomfort, feeling 'filled with water', pain. Onset 2-3 days ago, gradually worsening. Pain 0-4 daily, 6-7 after showering. Difficulty hearing left ear. Unable to swim due to pain worsening. New sport: swimming for few weeks. Cleans ears with cotton buds 3x/week. Negatives: No fever, no general illness, pain manageable (no painkillers taken). Social: Recently became Dutch citizen, holiday in Turkey (Cappadocia). Request: Wants ear examined, concerned about hearing, wants pain to stop.
Objective: Temp: 36.2 C. Right ear: Clean, eardrum fine. Left ear: Pain on pulling auricle. Ear canal red, inflamed, swollen, thick. Eardrum not well visible.
Assessment: Left otitis externa, likely due to frequent water exposure (swimming) and cotton bud use.
Plan: Explanation: Left ear canal inflamed from getting wet and cotton bud use.
Meds: Paracetamol up to 4000mg/day PRN for pain.
Meds: Anti-inflammatory, acidic ear drops 3x/day for 1 week.
Advice: No more cleaning with cotton buds.
Advice: Keep ear dry for 1 week.
